communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nebraska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

In March, the Nebraska Information Analysis Center (NIAC), a division of the Nebraska State Patrol, provided a bulletin to law enforcement agencies across the state and the Nebraska Department of Education regarding a trend of “swatting” calls that had been reported in several other states this year, including Arkansas, California, Colorado, Florida, Idaho, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Texas, and Vermont. That bulletin advised local agencies to be prepared in the event the calls target Nebraska schools.

- I am looking for a copy of this bulletin
- emails, communications, internal memos or directives about false reports of active shootings or swattings in the last year.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: SEPTA Public Announcement Audio Recordings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all audio recordings made for automated public announcement in SEPTA stations and on board any SEPTA vehicle including subway cars, trains, busses, and trolleys. This should include, but should not be limited to, route welcome announcements ("Welcome to Route 34...", etc), announcements for stops on a route, public safety announcements, next-to-arrive announcements, and door closing announcements.

If it exists, the search should include any chimes, bells, or other alerting noise that accompany these announcements.

If possible, the search should include recordings made for this purpose which are not actively used in SEPTA stations or on board SEPTA vehicles.

Recordings made for temporary use and intended for a limited time, for example announcements of temporary detours or schedule modifications, should be excluded from this search.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sharp Hall
